page.title: 16Bowd Lodge and Dob Hall Farm
page.content: Mr. Mason owns Bowd Lodge. He has 400 acres of flat land. He owns 100 acres and 187 acres belong to Rockingham Estates. Mr. Mason grows 200 acres of arable crops. The rest is for grazing 200 sheep. He breeds 100 bullocks for fattening. Oil Seed Rape is for vegetable oil and margarine. The disused buildings were part of an old airfield. They are used for any purpose, storing machinery, vehicles and fodder. At Dob Hall Farm they grow wheat. Across the road there are some old riding stables. There is also a small industrial area.It has a metal fence round it. On the same side as Dob Hall Farm is a chicken farm. There is an old war-time building which forms part of the industrial area.
